l.note: Close-Up [1927-1933]. An influential literary magazine devoted to film, published by the Pool Group between 1927 and 1933. The first issue of Close-Up described itself on the front cover as an "international magazine devoted to film art." Kenneth Macpherson was editor-in-chief, with Bryher as assistant editor, and Hilda Doolittle ("H.D.") making regular contributions.

The Aquabats at Coral GablesMM transcribes from a radio newscast or newsreel segment about an exhibition of diving experts at the Miami Biltmore Hotel pool in Coral Gables, Florida, in 1932. A newsreel titled "Pool Diving Entertains High Society" was made in 1932.
